newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Angola slows regional progress - Zimbabwe.
newsitem.headline: Angola slows regional progress - Zimbabwe.

text.p: Ths slow pace of the Angolan peace process is hampering the economic progress of southern Africa, Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe said.

At a dinner on Tuesday on the eve of a Southern Africa Trade and Investment Summit, he said the failure of peace talks in the Angolan capital Luanda three weeks ago was marginalising the country from regional economic growth.
"A major problem that remains unresolved is that of the peace process in Angola...peace and stability is a sine qua non for economic and social development," he said.
A 1994 peace deal to reconcile Angola's government with former UNITA rebels led by Jonas Savimbi is stalled and Savimbi refused to attend a summit of regional leaders three weeks ago.
The two-day trade and investment conference in Harare has pulled together political and business leaders from the southern African region to discuss how to boost trade and attract foreign investment.
